text:
Drone vs 'live'

<https://x.com/boots111/status/1733895234684166245>

attachments.fallback: X (formerly Twitter): Martin Hughes (@boots111) on X
attachments.text: Here’s an example of what you’re up against on SkySports tracks.
attachments.title: Martin Hughes (@boots111) on X

elements.text: Drone vs 'live'

text: I can see why people would find the drone feed more useful - more for the angle than the latency difference (especially in the finishing straight). Never used it myself but seen it posted that people have paid £500 a day for these pics. Could be absolute bollocks but thats quite a deficit to be making up the markets on a daily basis.

elements.text: I can see why people would find the drone feed more useful - more for the angle than the latency difference (especially in the finishing straight). Never used it myself but seen it posted that people have paid £500 a day for these pics. Could be absolute bollocks but thats quite a deficit to be making up the markets on a daily basis.

text: I believe it is now £300 per week for more or less every meeting

elements.text: I believe it is now £300 per week for more or less every meeting

text: Trust me, it's not the edge it used to be. 3-4yrs ago it was good when very few people had access to them

elements.text: Trust me, it's not the edge it used to be. 3-4yrs ago it was good when very few people had access to them

text: Interesting. I don't think it boils down to the amount of people who have access, rather the amount of those that know how to use it properly. Same goes for TPD - now its integrated into Bet Angel/GrussBetMover (and a lot cheaper than it used to be) I'd expected to see profits diminish but that has not happened.

elements.text: Interesting. I don't think it boils down to the amount of people who have access, rather the amount of those that know how to use it properly. Same goes for TPD - now its integrated into Bet Angel/GrussBetMover (and a lot cheaper than it used to be) I'd expected to see profits diminish but that has not happened.

text: You'd think that those capable of making 300 a week to cover the drone fees are quite small in number so the drop-off in cost for the drones is quite interesting. That said, I might have been way off with the £500 a day - you can't believe most of what you read on Twitter.

elements.text: You'd think that those capable of making 300 a week to cover the drone fees are quite small in number so the drop-off in cost for the drones is quite interesting. That said, I might have been way off with the £500 a day - you can't believe most of what you read on Twitter.

text: It’s an impressive skill using these feeds, would love to see footage of a user, it takes me the entire race to find a single runner and even then I am not 100%

elements.text: It’s
an impressive skill using these feeds, would love to see footage of a user, it takes me the entire race to find a single runner and even then I am not 100%

text: I can tell you it was unbelievably good for around 6 months since racing returned after covid. Then it started to get harder once more started teaming up to purchase drones. Then one particular individual, whose business model is not to bet but rather sell the pictures (also sold facetime pictures back in the day), purchased a drone. That killed it completely as it opened access to 100+ other players

elements.text: I can tell you it was unbelievably good for around 6 months since racing returned after covid. Then it started to get harder once more started teaming up to purchase drones. Then one particular individual, whose business model is not to bet but rather sell the pictures (also sold facetime pictures back in the day), purchased a drone. That killed it completely as it opened access to 100+ other players

text: Yeah those months after Covid are legendary, I will never match those numbers again

elements.text: Yeah those months after Covid are legendary, I will never match those numbers again

text: Yeah <@U4H19D1D2> matching colours to runners is a skill in itself. Especially these jumps races where you've got about 5 runners with green with gold hoops.

elements.text: Yeah
matching colours to runners is a skill in itself. Especially these jumps races where you've got about 5 runners with green with gold hoops.

text: I know the individual who first thought of the idea to use a drone many years ago. He and a select few had it to themselves for years. I remember him telling me that he would regularly win at least 8k per meeting at Southwell alone. He could see horses hit the front, going away, and still get odds against

I remember him telling me that he would regularly win at least 8k per meeting at Southwell alone. He could see horses hit the front, going away, and still get odds against

text: <@UUE6E1LA1> You use TPD? I want to mess around with their raw data but they only seem to offer it on commercial terms. Do you reckon I could subscribe to TPD zone and use something like WireShark or directly listen to the UDP port to get the raw data?

elements.text: You use TPD? I want to mess around with their raw data but they only seem to offer it on commercial terms. Do you reckon I could subscribe to TPD zone and use something like WireShark or directly listen to the UDP port to get the raw data?

text: I've no idea. There was a recent chat on here about TPD not providing like they used to (UDP) and that now you can only get it via an OTS trading product (BA/BM/Gruss) but if I were you and you are serious about it I would talk to the organ grinder and send them an email.

elements.text: I've no idea. There was a recent chat on here about TPD not providing like they used to (UDP) and that now you can only get it via an OTS trading product (BA/BM/Gruss) but if I were you and you are serious about it I would talk to the organ grinder and send them an email.

text: There is a TPD guy here recently  - I think <@U066B8Z0L3F> might be able to assist, if not send them an email.

elements.text: There is a TPD guy here recently  - I think
might be able to assist, if not send them an email.

text: Algo traders already trading with bots on Betfair can ask their betfair account manager about their passthrough integration of TPD data, or last I heard from the sales team we can supply UDP GPS direct for a fee, and visualiser/desktop punters are usually directed to one of those above services (BetAngel, BetMover, Gruss). UDP doesn't work with browsers so these are powered by a TCP websocket stream of the GPS data

elements.text: Algo traders already trading with bots on Betfair can ask their betfair account manager about their passthrough integration of TPD data, or last I heard from the sales team we can supply UDP GPS direct for a fee, and visualiser/desktop punters are usually directed to one of those above services (BetAngel, BetMover, Gruss). UDP doesn't work with browsers so these are powered by a TCP websocket stream of the GPS data

text: <@U066B8Z0L3F> Thank you for your reply. From what I can see the UDP feed is only available on commercial terms? I only ask this because I have no interest in using BetAngel etc- I would just like to experiment with the raw data in code for analysis, quant etc.. Not fussed about the method of delivery at this stage

elements.text: Thank you for your reply. From what I can see the UDP feed is only available on commercial terms? I only ask this because I have no interest in using BetAngel etc- I would just like to experiment with the raw data in code for analysis, quant etc.. Not fussed about the method of delivery at this stage

text: <@U05N9773A23> you've used TPD before a few years ago (according to your post in another thread) what mechanism did you use back then? Did you not log any of that data when you did have access to it?

elements.text: you've used TPD before a few years ago (according to your post in another thread) what mechanism did you use back then? Did you not log any of that data when you did have access to it?

text: I only just realised it was you as it looks like you've changed name recently.

elements.text: I only just realised it was you as it looks like you've changed name recently.

text: <@UUE6E1LA1> That was many years ago, long before it was available with BetAngel etc. It was offered as a raw UDP stream sent direct via a fixed IP address. I only trailed it for probably 2 dozen meetings and didn't proceed any further as I was unimpressed with the accuracy of the data. But I have heard it has improved recently

elements.text: That was many years ago, long before it was available with BetAngel etc. It was offered as a raw UDP stream sent direct via a fixed IP address. I only trailed it for probably 2 dozen meetings and didn't proceed any further as I was unimpressed with the accuracy of the data. But I have heard it has improved recently

text: Although personally I am sceptical

elements.text: Although personally I am sceptical

text: So you wrote your own software to render/display the GPS coords and didn't like what you saw?

elements.text: So you wrote your own software to render/display the GPS coords and didn't like what you saw?

text: More or less. I found the data was very frequently 2 lengths or more out, sometimes the horses were not even on the racetrack

elements.text: More or less. I found the data was very frequently 2 lengths or more out, sometimes the horses were not even on the racetrack

text: Interesting. I can't help but feel that you might have missed a trick. I mean, I agree with you about the occasional positional errors but to go to such lengths to pay for the data and write a stream listener app AND a viewer and then give up is an odd one. I wish I'd had access around when you did as there were far fewer GPSers around then. Out of interest what were you paying back then when you had it. I think I was quoted about £40 a meeting but you are the only person I've ever spoken to who has paid for the UDP feed direct from TPD as opposed to getting it via Betfair or OTS trading applications.

elements.text: Interesting. I can't help but feel that you might have missed a trick. I mean, I agree with you about the occasional positional errors but to go to such lengths to pay for the data and write a stream listener app AND a viewer and then give up is an odd one. I wish I'd had access around when you did as there were far fewer GPSers around then. Out of interest what were you paying back then when you had it. I think I was quoted about £40 a meeting but you are the only person I've ever spoken to who has paid for the UDP feed direct from TPD as opposed to getting it via Betfair or OTS trading applications.

text: <@U05N9773A23> Best to email the sales team (<mailto:info@totalperformancedata.com|info@totalperformancedata.com> i think) to see what they're offering these days, I don't get involved in that process much anymore unless I'm asked to prepare a sample of data for a prospective client

elements.text: Best to email the sales team (
info@totalperformancedata.com
i think) to see what they're offering these days, I don't get involved in that process much anymore unless I'm asked to prepare a sample of data for a prospective client

text: <@UUE6E1LA1> We are talking over 4 years ago. I contacted them directly and we agreed a select number of meetings on trial, mostly jumps. I can't remember the exact cost but it was far cheaper than £40 per meeting, perhaps as low as £10, but again it was just a trial. The direct UDP feed was the only way to consume the data back then. Perhaps it has improved, but for me, the positional errors were frequent, and sometimes very significant

elements.text: We are talking over 4 years ago. I contacted them directly and we agreed a select number of meetings on trial, mostly jumps. I can't remember the exact cost but it was far cheaper than £40 per meeting, perhaps as low as £10, but again it was just a trial. The direct UDP feed was the only way to consume the data back then. Perhaps it has improved, but for me, the positional errors were frequent, and sometimes very significant

text: Yeah the accuracy can be iffy at times.

elements.text: Yeah the accuracy can be iffy at times.

text: But benefits outweigh the odd glitch IMO

elements.text: But benefits outweigh the odd glitch IMO

text: <@UUE6E1LA1> I accept a margin of error, and the odd glitch but, at least back then, it was far too frequent to warrant the significant effort to train a model or code some automation strategy. It must have improved since

elements.text: I accept a margin of error, and the odd glitch but, at least back then, it was far too frequent to warrant the significant effort to train a model or code some automation strategy. It must have improved since

text: The feed is data gold, always has been

elements.text: The feed is data gold, always has been

text: Jumps has always been almost twice as inaccurate as flat, and over 4 years ago we were probably using a single tracker per horse, we have upgraded software now to handle two trackers per horse which is the standard, field size permitting, and has shown large improvements in accuracy since it was introduced sometime around mid 2020

elements.text: Jumps has always been almost twice as inaccurate as flat, and over 4 years ago we were probably using a single tracker per horse, we have upgraded software now to handle two trackers per horse which is the standard, field size permitting, and has shown large improvements in accuracy since it was introduced sometime around mid 2020

text: I agree with <@U4H19D1D2> although I was way later to use it.

elements.text: I agree with
although I was way later to use it.

text: Perhaps I should give it another go in-between the day job lol. But again, that's if I can even access the feed at a reasonable price for personal use
